intro: Odontarrhena fallacina, commonly known as the false sandalwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
